title.narrative: ICSU, Int Council for Science support to Global Environmental Change Research 2012-2013
ICSU, Int Council for Science, stöd till miljöforskning 2012-2013

description.narrative: Syftet är att testa/stärka samarbeten/länkar mellan olika globala/regionala strukturer samt stödja utvecklandet av gemensamma strategier genom att säkra de svagare regionernas deltagande i Rio+20 samt stärka deras inflytande på utformningen av Future Earth. Målet är långsiktig forskningssatsning som möjliggör för länderna att själva framställa den nya kunskap som är nödvändig för hållbar utv

The purpose is to test and strengthen partnerships and links between global and regional structures and support the development of common strategies by securing the weaker regions participate in Rio +20 and strengthen their influence on the design of Future Earth. The goal is long-term research initiative that enables the countries themselves to produce the new knowledge that is necessary for sustainable develo

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2014Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The intervention ensured that the scientific community in low-income countries was involved in defining and developing global research initiatives to address the Grand Challenges of Sustainability, especially in the design of Future Earth, and that the resulting international research agenda is responsive to the needs of low-income countries. As example of the above it may be mentioned the strong contribution from Africa, Asia and the Pacific and Latin-America and the Caribbean to the development of a Future Earth vision and to setting its initial research agenda. Also, an expanded community, with an increased engagement of early career scientists, and enhanced support for Future Earth at the regional and national levels was created with a Future Earth Regional Interim Committee for Africa established to work for regional Future Earth Node in Africa. More than 100 researchers, decision makers and practioners participated in capacity building activities during the project period. On major outcome was the improved understanding of African challenges and potential solutions related to urban food security, urban vulnerability and resilience, and climate change and health. The intervention enabled ICSU-Unesco regional workshops that provided input to Rio+20 and ICSU Regional Office for Africa became permanent partner in the regional Sustainable Development processes coordinated by UNECA. Meetings between donor agencies, funding agencies and researchers led to enhanced understanding of regional perspectives on development challenges in Africa and the role of research in addressing them. Areas common to development aid and research funding communities were identified.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
